intro: Adicea uliginosa, commonly known as the bog gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and bog environments in Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers in late summer, which are clustered in whorls along the stem. It thrives in acidic, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in marshes and heathlands. Adicea uliginosa is an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
